trans-unit.source: Deploy SharePoint farms with Azure Resource Manager templates | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy SharePoint farms with Azure Resource Manager templates | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Easily deploy a three-server or nine-server SharePoint farm with Resource Manager templates and the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell, or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Easily deploy a three-server or nine-server SharePoint farm with Resource Manager templates and the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell, or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Deploy SharePoint farms with Azure Resource Manager templates
trans-unit.target: Deploy SharePoint farms with Azure Resource Manager templates

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in this article to deploy a new three-server or nine-server SharePoint Server 2013 farm using Resource Manager templates.
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in this article to deploy a new three-server or nine-server SharePoint Server 2013 farm using Resource Manager templates.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a three-server SharePoint farm
trans-unit.target: Deploy a three-server SharePoint farm

trans-unit.source: For a basic SharePoint Server 2013 farm, a Resource Manager template creates three virtual machines in a new virtual network on three different subnets.
trans-unit.target: For a basic SharePoint Server 2013 farm, a Resource Manager template creates three virtual machines in a new virtual network on three different subnets.

trans-unit.source: You can run the template with the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell, or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: You can run the template with the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell, or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To deploy this workload using a Resource Manager template and the Azure preview portal, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To deploy this workload using a Resource Manager template and the Azure preview portal, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For the Template pane, click Save.
trans-unit.target: For the Template pane, click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click Parameters.
trans-unit.target: Click Parameters.

trans-unit.source: On the Parameters pane, enter new values, select from allowed values, or accept default values, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: On the Parameters pane, enter new values, select from allowed values, or accept default values, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: If needed, click Subscription and select the correct Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: If needed, click Subscription and select the correct Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Click Resource group and select an existing resource group.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource group and select an existing resource group.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, click Or create new to create a new one for this workload.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, click Or create new to create a new one for this workload.

trans-unit.source: If needed, click Resource group location and select the correct Azure location.
trans-unit.target: If needed, click Resource group location and select the correct Azure location.

trans-unit.source: If needed, click Legal terms to review the terms and agreement for using the template.
trans-unit.target: If needed, click Legal terms to review the terms and agreement for using the template.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the template, it can take some time for Azure to build the workload.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the template, it can take some time for Azure to build the workload.

trans-unit.source: When complete, you have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your existing or new resource group.
trans-unit.target: When complete, you have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your existing or new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, make sure you have the right version of Azure PowerShell installed, you have logged in, and you have switched to the new Resource Manager mode.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, make sure you have the right version of Azure PowerShell installed, you have logged in, and you have switched to the new Resource Manager mode.

trans-unit.source: For the details, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the details, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Fill in an Azure deployment name, a new Resource Group name, and an Azure datacenter location in the following set of commands. Remove everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: Fill in an Azure deployment name, a new Resource Group name, and an Azure datacenter location in the following set of commands. Remove everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example.

trans-unit.source: Next, run your command block in the Azure PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: Next, run your command block in the Azure PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: When you run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command, you will be prompted to supply the values for a series of parameters.
trans-unit.target: When you run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command, you will be prompted to supply the values for a series of parameters.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the parameter values, New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment creates and configures the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the parameter values, New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment creates and configures the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: When the template execution is complete, you have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your new resource group.
trans-unit.target: When the template execution is complete, you have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, make sure you have the right version of Azure CLI installed, you have logged in, and you have switched to the new Resource Manager mode.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, make sure you have the right version of Azure CLI installed, you have logged in, and you have switched to the new Resource Manager mode.

trans-unit.source: For the details, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the details, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: First, you create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: First, you create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command and specify the name of the group and the Azure data center location into which you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command and specify the name of the group and the Azure data center location into which you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: Next, use the following command and specify the name of your new resource group and the name of an Azure deployment.
trans-unit.target: Next, use the following command and specify the name of your new resource group and the name of an Azure deployment.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example.

trans-unit.source: When you run the azure group deployment create command, you will be prompted to supply the values for a series of parameters.
trans-unit.target: When you run the azure group deployment create command, you will be prompted to supply the values for a series of parameters.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the parameter values, Azure creates and configures the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the parameter values, Azure creates and configures the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: You now have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your new resource group.
trans-unit.target: You now have a new three-server SharePoint farm in your new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a nine-server SharePoint farm
trans-unit.target: Deploy a nine-server SharePoint farm

trans-unit.source: For a high-availability SharePoint Server 2013 farm, a Resource Manager template creates nine virtual machines in a new virtual network on four different subnets.
trans-unit.target: For a high-availability SharePoint Server 2013 farm, a Resource Manager template creates nine virtual machines in a new virtual network on four different subnets.

trans-unit.source: Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Azure preview portal

trans-unit.target: To deploy this workload using a Resource Manager template and the Azure preview portal, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
